definition: to hide/to go into hiding/to take refuge
to conceal/to hide away/to harbor/to store/to collect
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: 'And it's a better hiding-place than out here in the country.
sentences.chinese: 那兒是個比鄉間更好的藏身的地方。

sentences.english: Then again, Facebook is a real-name business, not a place for dissidents to go into hiding.
sentences.chinese: 而且臉譜網是實名業務，讓異見者無處藏身。

sentences.english: This must be the place where the mysterious man was hiding!
sentences.chinese: 這一定就是那位神祕人士的藏身之處了。

sentences.english: The police found an arsenal of knives and guns in the terrorists' hideout.
sentences.chinese: 警方在恐怖分子的藏身地發現大批刀槍。

sentences.english: Cosette crawled out of the sort of hole in which she had hidden herself. The Thenardier resumed
sentences.chinese: 珂賽特從她那藏身洞裏爬出來。

sentences.english: This small creature dishes out a shelter for itself in the ground.
sentences.chinese: 這個小動物會在地上挖凹形藏身洞。

sentences.english: And fate can find you anywhere.
sentences.chinese: 而在命運面前，你無處藏身。

sentences.english: Break into Riddler's secret hideout and exact your revenge.
sentences.chinese: 闖入謎語人的隱祕藏身所，實現你的復仇。

sentences.english: The clouds fill the water cups of the river, hiding themselves in the distant hills.
sentences.chinese: 雲把水倒入河流的杯盞裏，自己反而藏身於遠山中。

sentences.english: You have to flush the birds from their hiding place before you shoot them.
sentences.chinese: 在向鳥射擊之前，你得先將它們從藏身的地方趕出來。

sentences.english: The escaped prisoner beat about for some place to hide.
sentences.chinese: 逃犯倉惶尋找個藏身之處。

sentences.english: As a small country, Ireland is a hard place to hide in.
sentences.chinese: 愛爾蘭是個小國，想在此隱形藏身幾乎是不可能的。

sentences.english: Eg: The police descended on their hide-out.
sentences.chinese: 警察突然襲擊了他們的藏身處。

sentences.english: Upper Seasons Lake is a mythic hiding place of fire-breathing monsters.
sentences.chinese: 上季節海是神話中吐火妖怪藏身之地。

sentences.english: The escapees – hidden behind various shelves – look on with concern.
sentences.chinese: 越獄犯一夥藏身在架子後面，關切地注意情況的變化。

sentences.english: Perhaps the king used this as a hiding-place.
sentences.chinese: 或許國王用這裏做一個藏身處。

definition: to conceal oneself/to go into hiding/to take cover
to cover up/to conceal/to go into hiding
to stay for a time/to stop over/to lodge/to sink down (into soft ground)/leftovers
to hide/to conceal and avoid (contact)/to keep sth concealed
to slink/to move stealthily/to advance through the water
